Ingredients.4: 4  green onions, or to taste, chopped

Ingredients.10: 1 (4 ounce) can sliced black olives, drained

Directions.1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Directions.2: Heat a large, nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir ground beef in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Stir in seasoning mix until combined. Transfer beef mixture to a large bowl, reserving drippings in the skillet.

Directions.3: Add sweet and green onions to the pan drippings; cook and stir over medium heat until tender, 5 to 7 minutes.

Directions.4: Add onions to the beef mixture, along with cream cheese and salsa; stir until cream cheese is completely melted.

Directions.5: Arrange tortillas on a large, flat work surface. Divide beef mixture evenly among tortillas, spooning it in a line down the center of each tortilla. Sprinkle about 1 tablespoon pepper Jack cheese onto each tortilla, then roll tortilla up over the filling. Transfer to a baking dish. Pour enchilada sauce evenly over enchiladas, then sprinkle olives and remaining cheese over top.

Directions.6: Bake in the preheated oven until cheese melts completely, about 20 minutes.
